channel.title: Website problems
channel.description:
when i try to load a common website (any like moparisthebest.com) or myspace, yahoo, etc.. it comes up like this...
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/2v85lww.jpg[/img]
what could possibly be wrong?

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:10, topic:227677”][quote author=Unid H4x0r link=topic=299223.msg2405659#msg2405659 date=1219702109]
Where did you go to get the virus?
[/quote]Tbh I got this a long time ago (not sure how, accidental click?) upon visiting some mexican jokes site (an AD most likely, as ive been there before with no problem). ;)[/quote]
had the same thing also. and actually i just ignored it and the next time i restarted my computer it was gone…

Read full topic

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Unid H4x0r, post:9, topic:227677”]Where did you go to get the virus?[/quote]I got it from looking for a graphics library, I went on an Open Gl site, and it just downloaded on my computer, I manually removed it from the registry, unregistered all the dlls, and deleted the downloader.

Read full topic

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

TeleNubby:

Tbh I got this a long time ago (not sure how, accidental click?) upon visiting some mexican porn site (an AD most likely, as ive been there before with no problem).

Is that the correct answer?

[quote=“cooper, post:11, topic:227677”]I once got it from RuneScape.com. The last time I got it [vista antivirus 2008] it was attached to an exe, luckily I stopped the extractor before it finished.[/quote]I thought those people moderate their advertisements?

Read full topic

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:7, topic:227677”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=299223.msg2404520#msg2404520 date=1219633092]
Is that a virus or something?
[/quote]
Pretty much, once it infects your computer it displays fake warning messages (usually saying you have virii, porn tracks, spyware, etc) and doesn’t stop until you buy it. It goes under many different names as well.[/quote]another one i was infected with was “IE Antivirus 3.2”

Yes, it goes by a couple of names (ex. Antivirus XP, Xp Antivirus, Antivirus2008y)

Read full topic

Pretty much, once it infects your computer it displays fake warning messages (usually saying you have virii, porn tracks, spyware, etc) and doesn’t stop until you buy it. It goes under many different names as well.

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Is that a virus or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:227677”]It could be a number of things, either you have a virus that changed your hosts file or DNS servers, or your ISP is a victim of the recently discovered DNS cache poisoning attack. Check the latter here:

http://www.doxpara.com/?p=1162[/quote]thanks MITB, turns out it was the infamous “Antivirus 2008”

i got rid of it today manually

Read full topic

item.title: Website problems
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It could be a number of things, either you have a virus that changed your hosts file or DNS servers, or your ISP is a victim of the recently discovered DNS cache poisoning attack. Check the latter here:

Dan Kaminsky's Blog – 9 Jul 08

An Astonishing Collaboration

Wow. It’s out. It’s finally, finally out. Sweet! So there’s a bug in DNS, the name-to-address mapping system at the core of most Internet services. DNS goes bad, every website goe…

Read full topic
